edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
Class LSPQueryBuilder

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPQueryBuilder
public class LSPQueryBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

Creates an LSPQuery from incoming STARTS XML. Typically, this XML is being read by the FrontEndLSP from one of the parameters of its search() method. As it says in the FrontEndLSP, some information from the other SDLIP parameters must be merged with the information in the STARTS header. In particular:

  • The "sources" in the LSPQuery, that is the, BackEndLSPs to be searched, are a union of the "sources" in the STARTS XML, and the "subcollections" parameter from the SDLIP method call.
  • The number of documents to be returned is the MAX of the "max-docs" attribute of the STARTS XML, and the "numdocs" parameter from the SDLIP method call.
To achieve this policy, the LSPQueryBuilder simply accepts the STARTS XML, the SDLIP "subcollections", and the SDLIP "numdocs" in its factory method, and performs the necessary logic when creating the LSPQuery.

                        throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Creates an LSPQuery from incoming STARTS XML and the relevant SDLIP parameters.
Parameters:
reader - the Reader from which the STARTS XML can be read
numDocs - the "numdocs" parameter from sdlip.Search.search()
subCols - the "subcollections" parameter from sdlip.Search.search()
